text: Hey! Anyone know the code to include in a theme template to establish default padding on a core image and core form module? Nothing I've tried is working.

Hey everyone :wave: ,
I have a client that has created a subdomain at `events.<http://DOMAIN_NAME.com|DOMAIN_NAME.com>` and it will be used to host a big event they do yearly so it will have separate styling and branding than the main domain `<http://DOMAIN_NAME.com|DOMAIN_NAME.com>`. Is it possible to use a different theme for just the subdomain instead of the current theme or is that only available with Business Units? Any help is appreciated!

Definitely! A theme is not tied to a domain... so, while I wouldn't recommend it, you could use a different theme for each page of the website. :slightly_smiling_face: When you create a page, you select a theme and then a template from that theme. You'll have a different set of global elements, like header/footer, when using a different theme, but sounds like that shouldn't be an issue here. All good... proceed!
Thank you so much. I finally found it on the docs. You're right it looks like it's at the page level and doesn't effect anything on the core domain.  I appreciate the help <@U0397BZRK6G>!
